author: Leslie Scism
title: AIG Misses Wall Street Targets in Latest Quarter
text:
American International Group Inc. posted lower-than-expected first-quarter results as the companyâ€™s core business of selling property-casualty insurance to businesses remains a challenge to turn around.
The global insurance conglomerate, which also has one of the largest life-insurance and retirement-services businesses in the U.S., posted a 21% decline in net income. Its closely watched adjusted income, which strips out items judged nonrecurring, fell nearly 30%.
